<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: ByteArrayOutputStream outputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream( );
outputStream.write( avroBinaryValue );
outputStream.write( byteSchemaName );
outputStream.write( byteLMD );

byte c[] = outputStream.toByteArray( );
<<<explanation>>>: The ByteArrayOutputStream class in Java is used to write common data into multiple files. In this case, you can use it to merge your three byte arrays. After writing the data to the ByteArrayOutputStream object, you can use the toByteArray() method to retrieve the combined data. 

To split the combined byte array, you will need to know the lengths of the original byte arrays. You can then use the System.arraycopy method to copy the relevant parts of the combined array into new arrays. 

Please note that this method does not add any separators between the arrays, so you need to know exactly where one array ends and the next one starts. If you don't have this information, you will need to add some kind of separator between the arrays when you combine them.
